Cucumber Features

Expand All

Collapse All

Feature: [ASI_01] get vendor device list

Background

  1. Given an user exists
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:1
  2. And there is a NAS paired with user
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:9
  3. And an existing certificate and RSA key
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
features/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.feature:9

Scenario: [ASI_01_01_01] If there is no vendor device in database, user get vendor device list from ASI server.

  1. Given there is no vendor device in database
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:15
  2. And the ASI server return valid result
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:42
  3. When NAS send a GET request to /resource/1/vendor_devices with:
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:54
    certificate_serial
    VALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
    cloud_id
    VALID CLOUD ID
    mac_address
    VALID MAC ADDRESS
    serial_number
    VALID SERIAL NUMBER
    signature
    VALID SIGNATURE
  4. Then there is vendor device data in database
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:102
  5. And the response status should be "200"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  6. And the JSON response should include:
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
    ["cloud_id", "device_list"]
features/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.feature:28

Scenario: [ASI_01_01_02] If there is an existing vendor device in database, and has not updated in 10 minutes. the vendor device will not be updated.

  1. Given there is an existed vendor device in database
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:19
  2. And the ASI server return valid result
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:42
  3. When NAS send a GET request to /resource/1/vendor_devices with:
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:54
    certificate_serial
    VALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
    cloud_id
    VALID CLOUD ID
    mac_address
    VALID MAC ADDRESS
    serial_number
    VALID SERIAL NUMBER
    signature
    VALID SIGNATURE
  4. Then there is vendor device data in database
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:102
  5. And the updated time will keep the same
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:106
  6. And the response status should be "200"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  7. And the JSON response should include:
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
    ["cloud_id", "device_list"]
features/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.feature:48

Scenario: [ASI_01_01_03] If there is an existing vendor device in database, and has not updated in 10 minutes. the vendor device will be updated.

  1. Given there is an existed vendor device in database
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:19
  2. And the vendor device has updated more then 10 minutes
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:25
  3. And the ASI server return valid result
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:42
  4. When NAS send a GET request to /resource/1/vendor_devices with:
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:54
    certificate_serial
    VALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
    cloud_id
    VALID CLOUD ID
    mac_address
    VALID MAC ADDRESS
    serial_number
    VALID SERIAL NUMBER
    signature
    VALID SIGNATURE
  5. Then there is vendor device data in database
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:102
  6. And the updated time will be updated
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:110
  7. And the response status should be "200"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  8. And the JSON response should include:
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
    ["cloud_id", "device_list"]
features/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.feature:70

Scenario: [ASI_01_02] If there is no vendor device in database, user get vendor device list from ASI server with invalid certificate serial.

  1. Given there is no vendor device in database
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:15
  2. And the ASI server return valid result
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:42
  3. When NAS send a GET request to /resource/1/vendor_devices with:
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:54
    certificate_serial
    INVALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
    cloud_id
    VALID CLOUD ID
    mac_address
    VALID MAC ADDRESS
    serial_number
    VALID SERIAL NUMBER
    signature
    VALID SIGNATURE
  4. Then the response status should be "400"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  5. And the JSON response should include the error:
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:114
    error_code
    101
    description
    invalid signature.
features/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.feature:88

Scenario: [ASI_01_03] If there is no vendor device in database, user get vendor device list from ASI server with invalid cloud id.

  1. Given there is no vendor device in database
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:15
  2. And the ASI server return valid result
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:42
  3. When NAS send a GET request to /resource/1/vendor_devices with:
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:54
    certificate_serial
    CERTIFICATE SERIAL
    cloud_id
    INVALID CLOUD ID
    mac_address
    VALID MAC ADDRESS
    serial_number
    VALID SERIAL NUMBER
    signature
    VALID SIGNATURE
  4. Then the response status should be "400"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  5. And the JSON response should include the error:
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:114
    error_code
    201
    description
    invalid cloud id or token.
features/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.feature:105

    004
    description

Feature: [ASI_02] crawler

Background

  1. Given an user exists
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:1
features/ASI/02_crawler.feature:6

Scenario: [ASI_02_01_01] If there is an existing vendor device in database, and has not updated in 10 minutes. the vendor device will not be updated.

  1. Given there is an existed vendor device in database
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:19
  2. And the ASI server return valid result
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:42
  3. When NAS send a GET request to /resource/1/vendor_devices/crawl with:
    features/step_definitions/ASI/02_crawler.rb:1
  4. Then there is vendor device data in database
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:102
  5. And the updated time will keep the same
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:106
  6. And the response status should be "200"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  7. And the JSON response should include:
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
    ["result", "device_list"]
features/ASI/02_crawler.feature:19

Feature: [Console_01] Revoke User API

Background

  1. Given an device exists
    features/step_definitions/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status_steps.rb:1
  2. And an user exists
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:1
  3. And the device paired with the user
    features/step_definitions/REST/07_01_accept_invitation_api_steps.rb:1
  4. And user has gernerate an invitation key
    features/step_definitions/REST/07_01_accept_invitation_api_steps.rb:5
  5. And user accepted invitation before
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user_steps.rb:5
  6. And there is an existed vendor device in database
    features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:19
  7. And an existing certificate and RSA key
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
  8. And an existing client app and access token record
    features/step_definitions/REST/08_device_pairing_steps.rb:1
  9. And an existing access grand
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user_steps.rb:1
features/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user.feature:14

Scenario: [Console_01_01] Revoke user successfully

  1. When client send a PUT request to /v1/user/revoke with:
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user_steps.rb:9
    email
    VALID EMAIL
    certificate_serial
    VALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
    signature
    VALID SIGNATURE
    timestamp
    VALID TIMESTAMP
  2. Then the response status should be "200"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  3. And the user email is changed to a secure random string
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user_steps.rb:59
  4. And the pairing is deleted
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user_steps.rb:63
  5. And the accepted user is deleted
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user_steps.rb:67
  6. And the vendor device is deleted
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user_steps.rb:71
  7. And the access grant is revoked
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user_steps.rb:75
  8. And the access token is revoked
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user_steps.rb:79
features/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user.feature:31

Scenario: [Console_01_02] Failed to revoke user without timestamp

  1. When client send a PUT request to /v1/user/revoke with:
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user_steps.rb:9
    email
    VALID EMAIL
    certificate_serial
    VALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
    signature
    VALID SIGNATURE
  2. Then the response status should be "400"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  3. And the JSON response should be:
    features/step_definitions/REST/07_01_accept_invitation_api_steps.rb:61
    code
    400.37
    message
    Missing Required Header: X-Timestamp
features/Console/01_PCloud/01_revoke_user.feature:45

Feature: [Console_01_02] Get Certificate List

Background

  1. Given Server has an Certifcate data as below:
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/02_get_certificate_list_steps.rb:2
    {
  "serial": "53152101-d6fe-4cb7-afb7-64e0f905a4b6",
  "description": "DEVICE_CERT_DESCRIPTION1",
  "content": "CONTENT1",
  "created_at": "2017-07-14T02:56:42.276Z",
  "updated_at": "2017-07-18T01:48:48.008Z"
}
  2. Given Server has an Certifcate data as below:
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/02_get_certificate_list_steps.rb:2
    {
  "serial": "ee71bc0e-f4cc-45ec-bdde-dc545376e1e1",
  "description":"DEVICE_CERT_DESCRIPTION2",
  "content": "CONTENT2",
  "created_at": "2017-07-14T02:56:42.276Z",
  "updated_at": "2017-07-18T01:48:48.008Z"
}
  3. And an existing certificate and RSA key
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
features/Console/01_PCloud/02_get_certificate_list.feature:26

Scenario: [01_02_01] Missing Required Header: X-Timestamp

  1. When client send a GET request to /v1/device_certs with:
    features/step_definitions/Console/01_PCloud/02_get_certificate_list_steps.rb:7
    certificate_serial
    VALID_CERTIFICATE_SERIAL
    		{"code":"400.37","message":"Missing Required Header: X-Timestamp"}
    signature
    VALID_SIGNATURE
  2. Then the response status should be "400"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  3. And the JSON response should include error code: "400.37"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:85
  4. And the JSON response should include error message: "Missing Required Header: X-Timestamp"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:94

    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:94

    identity
    VALID IDENTITY
    template_contents_attributes
    VALID TEMPLATE CONTENTS ATTRIBUTES
  2. Then the response status should be "400"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  3. And the JSON response should be:
    features/step_definitions/REST/07_01_accept_invitation_api_steps.rb:61

    400.3
    message
    Invalid certificate_serial

features/Console/02_SSO/03_create_app.feature:113

Feature: [OAUTH_01] refresh token and get access token

Background

  1. Given an oauth client user exists
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:1
features/Oauth/01_refresh_token.feature:6

Scenario: [OAUTH_01_01] Valid client user renews access token with valid refresh token

  1. Given client user confirmed
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:5
  2. And 1 existing client app and access token record
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:10
  3. When client send a POST request to /oauth/token with:
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:21
    grant_type
    refresh_token
    refresh_token
    VALID REFRESH TOKEN
    client_id
    VALID CLIENT ID
    client_secret
    VALID CLIENT SECRET
    redirect_uri
    REDIRECT URI
  4. Then the response status should be "200"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  5. And the JSON response should include:
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
    ["access_token", "token_type", "expires_in", "refresh_token", "created_at"]
features/Oauth/01_refresh_token.feature:24

Scenario: [OAUTH_01_02] Valid client user renews access token with invalid refresh token

  1. Given client user confirmed
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:5
  2. And 1 existing client app and access token record
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:10
  3. When client send a POST request to /oauth/token with:
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:21
    grant_type
    refresh_token
    refresh_token
    INVALID REFRESH TOKEN
    client_id
    VALID CLIENT ID
    client_secret
    VALID CLIENT SECRET
    redirect_uri
    REDIRECT URI
  4. Then the response status should be "401"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  5. And the JSON response should include:
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
    ["error", "error_description"]
features/Oauth/01_refresh_token.feature:42

Scenario: [OAUTH_01_03] Invalid client user renews access token with valid refresh token

  1. Given client user did not confirmed and the trial period has been expired 3 days
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:72
  2. And 1 existing client app and access token record
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:10
  3. When client send a POST request to /oauth/token with:
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:21
    grant_type
    refresh_token
    refresh_token
    VALID REFRESH TOKEN
    client_id
    VALID CLIENT ID
    client_secret
    VALID CLIENT SECRET
    redirect_uri
    REDIRECT URI
  4. Then the response status should be "400"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  5. And the JSON response should include:
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
    ["error", "error_description"]
  6. And the refresh token will be revoked
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:77

  1. Given client user confirmed
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:5
  2. And 1 existing client app and grant code record
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:15

    client_id

    VALID CLIENT SECRET

  1. Given client user confirmed
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:5
  2. And 1 existing client app and access token record
    features/step_definitions/Oauth/01_refresh_token_steps.rb:10

    features/step_definitions/Oauth/02_get_user_information_steps.rb:1
    access_token
    VALID ACCESS TOKEN
  4. Then the response status should be "200"
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
  5. And the JSON response should include:
    features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19

    features/step_definitions/Oauth/02_get_user_information_steps.rb:17

Mac Address
%%:%%:%%:%%:%%:%%
is invalid

is invalid

not found

not found

  2. And the user click the copy button of device within 10 minutes
    features/step_definitions/PCP_003/03_pairing_steps.rb:87
  3. Then the user should see "Successfully paired." message on pairing page
    features/step_definitions/PCP_003/03_pairing_steps.rb:146
  4. And the user should see "DDNS Setting" button on pairing page
    features/step_definitions/PCP_003/03_pairing_steps.rb:150

Feature: [PCP_004_02] DDNS Setup

Background

  1. Given the user have a paired device
    features/step_definitions/session_steps.rb:146
  2. And the user visits DDNS setup page
    features/step_definitions/PCP_004/02_ddns_setup_steps.rb:1
features/PCP_004/02_ddns_setup.feature:8

Scenario Outline: [PCP_004_02_01] Show error message when hostname invalid

  1. And the user filled the invalid Hostname <Hostname>
    features/step_definitions/PCP_004/02_ddns_setup_steps.rb:16
  2. When the user click "Submit" button
    features/step_definitions/session_steps.rb:129
  3. Then the user should see error message for Hostname
    features/step_definitions/PCP_004/02_ddns_setup_steps.rb:54

Examples

Hostname
hi
Your host name must be at least 3 characters long. Please try another.
hi@
is invalid
0A0
is invalid
1234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234
is invalid
features/PCP_004/02_ddns_setup.feature:20

    features/step_definitions/session_steps.rb:129
  3. Then the user should see error message for Hostname
    features/step_definitions/PCP_004/02_ddns_setup_steps.rb:54
  4. test.lovefunthing.com is exist. Please try another

  6. And the user click "Confirm" link
    features/step_definitions/session_steps.rb:134

      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:19

      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:1
    4. Then the visitor should see a "Invitation accept failed" message and button for "Retry"
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:28
    features/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation.feature:35

    Scenario: [PCP_005_01_05] Show error message when already accepted by user

    1. Given user logined
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:10
    2. And user already acceped this invitation
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:33
    3. And connect success but server send failure message with error code
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:38
    4. When a user visits accept invitation page
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:1
    5. Then the invitation page should see an error message for "This myZyxelCloud account has already been added"
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:69
    features/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation.feature:43

    Scenario: [PCP_005_01_06] Show error message when invitation key counting expired

    1. Given user logined
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:10
    2. And the invitation key expire count is zero
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:44
    3. When a user visits accept invitation page
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:1
    4. Then the invitation page should see an error message for "Invitation accept failed"
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:69
    features/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation.feature:50

    Scenario: [PCP_005_01_07] Show success message when server return done message in time

    1. Given user logined
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:10
    2. And connect success and server send success message
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:23
    3. When a user visits accept invitation page
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:1
    4. Then the visitor should see a "Invitation accept success" message and button for "Next"
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:28
    features/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation.feature:57

    Scenario: [PCP_005_01_08] Redirect user to login page when click "Confirm" button

    1. Given user logined
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:10
    2. And connect success and server send success message
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:23
    3. When a user visits accept invitation page
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:1
    4. And user click "Next" button
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:48
    5. Then user will redirect to Zyxel drive landing page
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:56
    features/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation.feature:65

    Scenario: [PCP_005_01_09] Redirect user to accept invitation page when click "Retry" button

    1. Given user logined
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:10
    2. And connect over 30 sec and server send "timeout" message
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:19
    3. When a user visits accept invitation page
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:1
    4. And user click "Retry" button
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:48
    5. Then the visitor should reload this page for retry
      features/step_definitions/PCP_005/01_accept_invitation_steps.rb:60
    @javascript

    Feature: [PCP_007_01] Visit Download EDM Users List Page

    features/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list.feature:4

    Scenario: [PCP_007_01_01] If the user dosen't sign in, he cannot visit the edm users list page and will redirect to root page.

    1. Given a user visits download edm users list page without signing in
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:1
    2. Then user is redirected to sign in page
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:5
    features/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list.feature:10

    Scenario: [PCP_007_01_02] If the user signed in but he is not the admin, he will be redirected to root page.

    1. Given a user signed in
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:9
    2. And user visits download edm users list page without admin authority
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:16
    3. Then user is redirected to root page
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:20
    features/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list.feature:17

    Scenario: [PCP_007_01_03] If the user signed in but the session name key is wrong, he will be redirected to root page.

    1. Given a user signed in
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:9
    2. And the session name key is wrong
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:24
    3. And user visits download edm users list page without admin authority
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:16
    4. Then user is redirected to root page
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:20
    features/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list.feature:25

    Scenario: [PCP_007_01_03] If the user signed in without the session auth key "download_edm_users", he will be redirected to root page.

    1. Given a user signed in
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:9
    2. And the session name key is right
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:28
    3. And the session auth key doesn't have "download_edm_users"
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:32
    4. And user visits download edm users list page without admin authority
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:16
    5. Then user is redirected to root page
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:20
    features/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list.feature:34

    Scenario: [PCP_007_01_03] If the user signed in and he is the admin, he can visit the edm users list page. The user only used email account to sign in.

    1. Given a user signed in
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:9
    2. And the session name key is right
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:28
    3. And user visits download edm users list page with admin authority
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:36
    4. Then user visits the edm users list page
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:41
    5. And we make the csv file name as "EDM-Users-List-20160531072030.csv"
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:45
    6. And the user click on "Download"
      features/step_definitions/session_steps.rb:138
    7. And the user sees the download csv file as "EDM-Users-List-20160531072030.csv"
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:49
    8. And the user sees the csv header include:
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:53
      ["email", "edm_accept", "language", "country", "sign_on_by"]
    9. And the csv content should have user information with sign_on_by "email"
      features/step_definitions/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list_steps.rb:59
    features/PCP_007/01_download_edm_users_list.feature:51

    Scenario: [PCP_007_01_04] If the user signed in and he is the admin, he can visit the edm users list page. The user also used Facebook and Google to sign in.

    1. Given the device is not registered
      features/step_definitions/REST/device_register_common_steps/device_register_common_steps.rb:46
    2. And the device "<information>" was be changed to "<value>"
      features/step_definitions/REST/device_register_common_steps/device_register_common_steps.rb:74

    3. Then the API should return success respond
      features/step_definitions/REST/device_register_common_steps/device_register_common_steps.rb:89
    4. And the record in databases as expected
      features/step_definitions/REST/device_register_common_steps/device_register_common_steps.rb:65
    # ------------------------------------------ #
    # ----- Given the device is registered ----- #
    # ------------------------------------------ #
    features/REST/00_02_device_register_v3.feature:45

    Scenario Outline: [REST_00_02_03] Check correct update process when valid format and IP changed

    2. And the device has a DDNS record, and ip is "173.194.112.35"

    Feature: [REST_00_03] Device Register V3 Lite

    # ---------------- #
    # ----- Note ----- #
    # ---------------- #
    # /d/3/register/lite 功能：
    # * 使 Personal Cloud Findme 可透過 redis session 中找到對應的 device。
    # * lite 僅會寫入 redis，不會儲存資料在 DB 中，寫入的欄位包含：
    #    + origin_id, => redis hash key: "mac_address + serial_number"
    #    + mac_address,
    #    + serial_number,
    #    + model_class_name,
    #    + firmware_version,
    #    + ip_address,
    #    + lan_ip

    Background

    1. Given the device with information
      features/step_definitions/REST/device_register_common_steps/device_register_common_steps.rb:3
      mac_address
      099789665701
      serial_number
      A123456
      model_name
      NSA325
      firmware_version
      1.0
      algo
      1
      ip_address
      173.194.112.35
      registered
      undefined
    2. And an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    # ---------------------------------------------- #
    # ----- Given the device is not registered ----- #
    # ---------------------------------------------- #
    features/REST/00_03_device_register_v3_lite.feature:32

    Scenario Outline: [REST_00_03_01] Check incorrect update process when invalid format or invalid signature

    1. Given the device is not registered
      features/step_definitions/REST/device_register_common_steps/device_register_common_steps.rb:46
    2. And the device "<information>" was be changed to "<value>"
      features/step_definitions/REST/device_register_common_steps/device_register_common_steps.rb:74
    3. When the device send "register" request to REST API /d/3/register/lite
      features/step_definitions/REST/00_03_device_register_v3_lite_steps.rb:6
    4. Then the API should return "<http_status>" and "<json_message>" with "<json_message_column>" responds
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:116

    Examples Invalid parameters format

    information
    value
    http_status
    json_message
    json_message_column
    mac_address
    @@@@@@@@@
    400
    invalid parameter
    failure
    mac_address
    6D-81-45-4B-1A-B8
    400
    invalid parameter
    failure
    mac_address
    A6:3A:B9:05:3E:B3
    400
    invalid parameter
    failure
    signature
    abcd
    400
    Invalid signature
    error
    features/REST/00_03_device_register_v3_lite.feature:45

    Scenario: [REST_00_03_02] Check standard device registration process

    1. Given the device is not registered
      features/step_definitions/REST/device_register_common_steps/device_register_common_steps.rb:46
    2. When the device send "register" request to REST API /d/3/register/lite
      features/step_definitions/REST/00_03_device_register_v3_lite_steps.rb:6
    3. Then the API should return success respond
      features/step_definitions/REST/device_register_common_steps/device_register_common_steps.rb:89
    # ------------------------------------------ #
    # ----- Given the device is registered ----- #
    # ------------------------------------------ #
    features/REST/00_03_device_register_v3_lite.feature:55

    Scenario Outline: [REST_00_03_03] Check correct update process when valid format and IP changed

    2. And the device "<information>" was be changed to "<value>"

    Feature: [REST_01_01] Sign in from RESTful API with E-mail account

    features/REST/01_01_sign_in_from_restful_api_with_email_account.feature:3

    Scenario: [REST_01_01_01] User sign in from NAS

    1. Given an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    2. Given an existing user's account and password
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:12
    3. When client send a POST request to /user/1/token with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_01_sign_in_form_restful_api_with_email_account_steps.rb:1
      id
      acceptance@ecoworkinc.com
      password
      secret123
    4. Then the response status should be "200"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    5. And the JSON response should include:
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
      ["user_id", "account_token", "authentication_token", "timeout", "confirmed", "registered_at", "bot_list", "stun_ip_addresses", "xmpp_account", "xmpp_ip_addresses"]
    features/REST/01_01_sign_in_from_restful_api_with_email_account.feature:16

    Scenario Outline: [REST_01_01_02] User sign in from APP

    1. Given an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    2. Given an existing user's account and password
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:12
    3. When client send a POST request to /user/1/token with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_01_sign_in_form_restful_api_with_email_account_steps.rb:1

      mobile_app_notification_key
      os
      <os_version>

      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76

      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
      ["user_id", "account_token", "authentication_token", "timeout", "confirmed", "registered_at", "bot_list", "stun_ip_addresses", "xmpp_account", "xmpp_ip_addresses"]

      features/step_definitions/REST/01_01_sign_in_form_restful_api_with_email_account_steps.rb:27

      VALID_CLOUD_ID
      authentication_token
      INVALID AUTHENTICATION TOKEN
    4. Then the response status should be "400"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    5. And the JSON response should include error code: "201"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:85
    6. And the JSON response should include description: "Invalid cloud id or token."
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:99
    7. And Email deliveries should be 0
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:112
    features/REST/01_05_modify_email_address.feature:31

    Scenario: [REST_01_05_03] modify email account with the same one

    1. Given a signed in client
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:44
    2. And client has not confirmed
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_05_modify_email_address_steps.rb:19
    3. When client send a PUT request to /user/1/email with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_05_modify_email_address_steps.rb:1
      email
      THE_SAME_EMAIL
      cloud_id
      VALID_CLOUD_ID
      authentication_token
      VALID AUTHENTICATION TOKEN

    Background

    1. Given the client has access token and uuid from facebook
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_06_facebook_checkin_steps.rb:1
    2. And an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    features/REST/01_06_facebook_checkin.feature:7

    Scenario: [REST_01_06_01] Client sign in by facebook uuid and access token with binding account

    1. Given client has registered in Rest API by facebook account and password "test_password"
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_06_facebook_checkin_steps.rb:25
    2. And this account is already binding to "facebook"
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_06_facebook_checkin_steps.rb:38
    3. When client send a GET request to /user/1/checkin/facebook with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_06_facebook_checkin_steps.rb:46
      user_id
      USER ID
      access_token
      ACCESS TOKEN
    4. Then the response status should be "200"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    5. And the JSON response should include:
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
      ["result", "account"]

      features/step_definitions/REST/01_08_google_checkin_steps.rb:1

      features/step_definitions/REST/01_08_google_checkin_steps.rb:1

      access_token
      INVALID ACCESS TOKEN
    4. Then the response status should be "400"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    5. And the JSON response should include error code: "000"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:85
    6. And the JSON response should include description: "Invalid Google account"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:99

      USER ID

      ACCESS TOKEN

    Feature: [REST_01_09] Google Register

    Background

    1. Given the client has access token and uuid from google
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_09_google_register_steps.rb:1
    features/REST/01_09_google_register.feature:6

    Scenario: [REST_01_09_01] Client register by google uuid and access token

    1. Given an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    2. When client send a POST request to /user/1/register/google with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_09_google_register_steps.rb:13
      user_id
      USER ID
      access_token
      ACCESS TOKEN
      password
      test_password
      signature
      SIGNATURE
      Accept-Language
      fr
    3. Then the response status should be "200"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    4. And the JSON response should include:
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
      ["user_id", "account_token", "authentication_token", "timeout", "confirmed", "registered_at", "bot_list", "xmpp_ip_addresses", "stun_ip_addresses", "xmpp_account"]
    5. And Portal's language should be changed to "fr"
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_02_register_with_email_account_steps.rb:29
    features/REST/01_09_google_register.feature:22

    Scenario: [REST_01_09_02] Client register by invalid google uuid and access token

    1. Given an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    2. When client send a POST request to /user/1/register/google with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_09_google_register_steps.rb:13
      user_id
      INVALID USER ID
      access_token
      INVALID ACCESS TOKEN
      password
      test_password
      signature
      SIGNATURE
    3. Then the response status should be "400"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    4. And the JSON response should include error code: "001"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:85
    5. And the JSON response should include description: "Invalid Google account"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:99

    Scenario Outline: [REST_01_09_03] Client register by google uuid and access token with invalid password

    1. Given an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    2. When client send a POST request to /user/1/register/google with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_09_google_register_steps.rb:13
      user_id
      USER ID
      access_token
      ACCESS TOKEN
      password
      <password>
      signature
      SIGNATURE
    3. Then the response status should be "400"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    4. And the JSON response should include error code: "002"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:85
    5. And the JSON response should include description: "Password has to be 8-14 characters length"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:99

    Examples

    password
    123
    123456789012345
    features/REST/01_09_google_register.feature:50

    Feature: [REST_01_12] Log out from RESTful API

    Background

    1. Given a signed in client
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:44
    features/REST/01_12_log_out_from_restful_api.feature:6

    Scenario: [REST_12_01] client try to log out with valid clout id and account token

    1. When client send a DELETE request to /user/1/token with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_12_log_out_from_restful_api_steps.rb:1
      cloud_id
      ENCODED USER ID
      account_token
      ACCOUNT_TOKEN
    2. Then the response status should be "200"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    3. And the JSON response should be
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:108
      {"result":"success"}
    features/REST/01_12_log_out_from_restful_api.feature:17

    Scenario: [REST_12_02] client try to sign in again with invalid cloud_id

    Feature: [REST_01_13] Get User's Email

    Background

    1. Given a signed in client
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:44
    2. And an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    features/REST/01_13_get_users_email.feature:7

    Scenario Outline: [REST_13_01] device try to query user’s email by cloud_ids

    1. Given a device has <record_count> emails including <valid> cloud_id and some <invalid> cloud_id with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_13_get_users_email_steps.rb:1
    2. When device request GET to /user/1/email with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_13_get_users_email_steps.rb:21
      cloud_ids
      ENCODED USER ID
      certificate_serial
      SERIAL_NAME
      signature
      SIGNATURE
    3. Then the response status should be "200"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    4. And the JSON response at "emails" size should be equal to valid cloud_id number
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_13_get_users_email_steps.rb:38
    5. And the JSON response at "ids_not_found" size should be equal to invalid cloud_id number
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_13_get_users_email_steps.rb:43

    valid
    invalid
    0
    0
    0
    1
    1
    0
    5
    2

    Feature: [REST_04] Delete User's Binding with Device

    Background

    1. Given a signed in client
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:44
    2. And an existing device with pairing signed in client
      features/step_definitions/REST/03_generate_invitation_key_steps.rb:1
    3. And 1 existing invitation record
      features/step_definitions/REST/02_01_get_invitation_key_list_steps.rb:1
    4. And an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    features/REST/04_delete_user_binding_with_device.feature:9

    Scenario: [REST_04_01] Client try to delete user's binding on portal with valid information

    1. When client send a DELETE request to /resource/1/permission with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/04_delete_user_binding_with_device_steps.rb:2
      device_account
      DEVICE XMPP ACCOUNT
      cloud_id
      ENCODED USER ID
      certificate_serial
      CERTIFICATE SERIAL
      signature
      SIGNATURE
    2. Then the response status should be "200"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    3. And the JSON response should be
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:108
      {"result":"success"}
    4. And permission record count should be 0
      features/step_definitions/REST/04_delete_user_binding_with_device_steps.rb:22
    features/REST/04_delete_user_binding_with_device.feature:23

    Scenario: [REST_04_02] Client try to delete user's binding on portal with invalid device account

    Feature: [REST_05] Request User's Device List API Testing

    Background

    1. Given a signed in client
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:44
    features/REST/05_request_users_device_list.feature:6

    Scenario Outline: [REST_05_01] request user device list with valid authentication token

    1. Given a user try to request own device list with <record_count> devices including <own> device and <other> device from APP
      features/step_definitions/REST/05_request_users_device_list_steps.rb:1
    2. When client send a GET request to "/resource/1/device_list" with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_10_token_validation_steps.rb:1
      cloud_id
      ENCODE USER ID
      authentication_token
      VALID AUTHENTICATION TOKEN
    3. Then the response status should be "200"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    4. And the JSON response should include
      features/step_definitions/REST/05_request_users_device_list_steps.rb:36
      ["xmpp_account", "mac_address", "host_name", "wan_ip", "firmware_ver", "last_update_time", "is_owner"]

    record_count
    own
    other
    0
    0
    0
    1
    1
    0
    5
    2
    3
    features/REST/05_request_users_device_list.feature:23

    Scenario: [REST_05_02] request user device list with expired authentication token

    1. Given a user try to request own device list with 1 devices including 1 device and 0 device from APP
      features/step_definitions/REST/05_request_users_device_list_steps.rb:1
    2. When client send a GET request to "/resource/1/device_list" with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/01_10_token_validation_steps.rb:1
      cloud_id
      ENCODE USER ID
      authentication_token
      EXPIRED AUTHENTICATION TOKEN
    3. Then the response status should be "400"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    4. And the JSON response should include error code: "201"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:85
    5. And the JSON response should include description: "Invalid cloud id or token."
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:99
    features/REST/05_request_users_device_list.feature:34

    Scenario Outline: [REST_05_03] request user device list with valid access token

    1. Given a user try to request own device list with <record_count> devices including <own> device and <other> device from APP
      features/step_definitions/REST/05_request_users_device_list_steps.rb:1
    2. When client send a GET request to "/resource/1/device_list" with:

    Feature: [REST_06_01] Get Device Online Status

    Background

    1. Given an device exists
      features/step_definitions/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status_steps.rb:1
    2. And an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    features/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status.feature:9

    Scenario: [REST_06_01_01] If there is a device in database, user gets device online status successfully.

    1. When user sends a GET request to /device/1/online_status with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status_steps.rb:6
      certificate_serial
      VALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
      device_id
      VALID DEVICE ID
      signature
      VALID SIGNATURE
    2. Then the response status should be "200"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    3. And the JSON response should include:
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:19
      ["device_id", "online_status"]
    features/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status.feature:26

    Scenario: [REST_06_01_02] If user gets device online status with missing params, user will see error message.

    1. When user sends a GET request to /device/1/online_status with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status_steps.rb:6
      device_id
      VALID DEVICE ID
      signature
      VALID SIGNATURE
    2. Then the response status should be "400"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    3. And the JSON response should include the error:
      features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:114
      error_code
      000
      description
      Missing required params.
    features/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status.feature:42

      certificate_serial

      device_id

    Feature: [REST_07_01] Accept Invitation API

    Background

    1. Given an device exists
      features/step_definitions/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status_steps.rb:1
    2. And an user exists
      features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:1
    3. And the device paired with the user
      features/step_definitions/REST/07_01_accept_invitation_api_steps.rb:1
    4. And user has gernerate an invitation key
      features/step_definitions/REST/07_01_accept_invitation_api_steps.rb:5
    5. And an invitee exists
      features/step_definitions/REST/07_01_accept_invitation_api_steps.rb:11
    6. And an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    features/REST/07_01_accept_invitation_api.feature:11

    Scenario: [REST_07_01_01] The invitee accepts invitation successfully.

      features/step_definitions/REST/07_01_accept_invitation_api_steps.rb:18
      cloud_id
      VALID INVITEE CLOUD ID
      invitation_key
      VALID INVITATION KEY
      certificate_serial
      VALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
      signature
      VALID SIGNATURE

      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76

      features/step_definitions/REST/07_01_accept_invitation_api_steps.rb:61

    Feature: [REST_07_02] Check Accepting Status API

    Background

    1. Given an device exists
      features/step_definitions/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status_steps.rb:1
    2. And an user exists
      features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:1

      Invalid cloud id.
    features/REST/07_02_check_accepting_status_api.feature:57

    Feature: [REST_08] Device Pairing API

    Background

    1. Given an device exists
      features/step_definitions/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status_steps.rb:1
    2. And an user exists
      features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:1
    3. And an existing client app and access token record
      features/step_definitions/REST/08_device_pairing_steps.rb:1
    4. And an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    features/REST/08_device_pairing.feature:9

    Scenario: [REST_08_01] Device paired with user successfully.

    1. When device sends a POST request to "/d/1/pairing" with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/08_device_pairing_steps.rb:6
      access_token
      VALID ACCESS TOKEN
      certificate_serial
      VALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
      cloud_id
      VALID CLOUD ID
      mac_address
      VALID MAC ADDRESS
      serial_number
      VALID SERIAL NUMBER
      signature
      VALID SIGNATURE
    2. Then the response status should be "200"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    3. Then the user and the device have been paired
      features/step_definitions/REST/08_device_pairing_steps.rb:77
    features/REST/08_device_pairing.feature:23

    Scenario: [REST_08_02] Device fails to pair if signature is empty.

      features/step_definitions/REST/08_device_pairing_steps.rb:6
      aceess_token
      VALID ACCESS TOKEN
      certificate_serial
      VALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
      cloud_id
      VALID CLOUD ID
      mac_address
      VALID MAC ADDRESS
      serial_number
      VALID SERIAL NUMBER
    2. Then the response status should be "400"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76

      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:85

    Feature: [REST_09] Device Send Notifications API

    Background

    1. Given an device exists
      features/step_definitions/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status_steps.rb:1
    2. And an user exists
      features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:1

      features/step_definitions/REST/09_device_send_notifications_steps.rb:1

    Feature: [REST_10] Device Unpair API

    Background

    1. Given an device exists
      features/step_definitions/REST/06_01_get_device_online_status_steps.rb:1
    2. And an user exists
      features/step_definitions/ASI/01_get_vendor_device_list.rb:1
    3. And the device paired with the user
      features/step_definitions/REST/07_01_accept_invitation_api_steps.rb:1
    4. And an existing certificate and RSA key
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:104
    features/REST/10_device_unpair.feature:9

    Scenario: [REST_10_01_01] Device unpaired successfully if paired time is over 10 minutes.

    1. Given paired time is "30" minutes ago
      features/step_definitions/REST/10_device_unpair_steps.rb:59
    2. When device sends a DELETE request to "/d/1/unpair" with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/10_device_unpair_steps.rb:1
      certificate_serial
      VALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
      mac_address
      VALID MAC ADDRESS
      serial_number
      VALID SERIAL NUMBER
      signature
      VALID SIGNATURE
    3. Then the response status should be "200"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    4. Then the device has been unpaired
      features/step_definitions/REST/10_device_unpair_steps.rb:51
    features/REST/10_device_unpair.feature:22

    Scenario: [REST_10_01_02] Device unpaired successfully if paired time is less than 10 minutes.

    1. Given paired time is "5" minutes ago
      features/step_definitions/REST/10_device_unpair_steps.rb:59
    2. When device sends a DELETE request to "/d/1/unpair" with:
      features/step_definitions/REST/10_device_unpair_steps.rb:1
      certificate_serial
      VALID CERTIFICATE SERIAL
      mac_address
      VALID MAC ADDRESS
      serial_number
      VALID SERIAL NUMBER
      signature
      VALID SIGNATURE
    3. Then the response status should be "200"
      features/step_definitions/api_common_steps.rb:76
    4. Then the device has not been unpaired
      features/step_definitions/REST/10_device_unpair_steps.rb:55
    features/REST/10_device_unpair.feature:35

    Feature: [Service_01] Ddns expire

    Background

    1. Given an user who has a device and pairing
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:1
    features/Service/ddns_expire.feature:6

    Scenario: [Service_01_01] Ddns record which has been not used for 60 days then device user should receive a warning mail after next scan

    1. Given device has been not used more than 60 days
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:13
    2. When ddns expire scan
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:25
    3. Then user should receive a warning email
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:31
    4. And ddns record should still exist
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:35
    features/Service/ddns_expire.feature:13

    Scenario: [Service_01_02] Ddns record which has received warning mail and has been not used for 90 days should be deleted after next scan

    1. Given device has been not used more than 90 days
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:13
    2. And user has received warning email on previous scan
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:39
    3. When ddns expire scan
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:25
    4. And user should not receive any warning email
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:47
    features/Service/ddns_expire.feature:21

    Scenario: [Service_01_03] Ddns record which has a activity in recent should not receive any warning mail and should not be deleted after next scan

    1. Given device has been not used more than 1 days
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:13
    2. When ddns expire scan
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:25
    3. Then ddns record should still exist
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:35
    4. And user should not receive any warning email
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:47
    features/Service/ddns_expire.feature:28

    Scenario: [Service_01_04] Device user has received warning email and device is used recently, Ddns record should not be deleted after next scan

    1. Given device has been not used more than 1 days
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:13
    2. And user has received warning email on previous scan
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:39
    3. When ddns expire scan
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:25
    4. Then ddns record should still exist
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:35
    5. And user should not receive any warning email
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:47
    features/Service/ddns_expire.feature:36

    Scenario: [Service_01_05] Device user has received warning email on previous scan, and user should not receive warning email again on next scan

    1. Given device has been not used more than 60 days
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:13
    2. And user has received warning email on previous scan
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:39
    3. When ddns expire scan
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:25
    4. Then user should not receive any warning email
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:47
    5. And ddns record should still exist
      features/step_definitions/Service/ddns_expire_steps.rb:35
